SubSteps Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2013-01-07  | Version: 1.1.0

Links

substeps:run-features

Full name:

com.technophobia.substeps:substeps-maven-plugin:1.1.0:run-features

Description:

Mojo to run a number SubStep features, each contained within any number of executionConfigs, encapsulating the required config and setup and tear down details

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven 2.0 project to be executed.
  • Requires dependency resolution of artifacts in scope: test.
  • Binds by default to the lifecycle phase: integration-test.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
runTestsInForkedVM boolean - if true a jvm will be spawned to run substeps otherwise substeps will execute within the same jvm as maven
Default value is: true.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
executionConfigs List - See ExecutionConfig
executionReportBuilder ExecutionReportBuilder - The execution report builder you wish to use
jmxPort Integer - When running in forked mode, a port is required to communicate between maven and substeps, to set explicitly use -DjmxPort=9999
Default value is: 9999.
stepImplementationArtifacts List - List of classes containing step implementations e.g. com.technophobia.substeps.StepImplmentations
vmArgs String - A space delimited string of vm arguments to pass to the forked jvm

Parameter Details

executionConfigs:

See ExecutionConfig
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Required: No

executionReportBuilder:

The execution report builder you wish to use
  • Type: com.technophobia.substeps.report.ExecutionReportBuilder
  • Required: No

jmxPort:

When running in forked mode, a port is required to communicate between maven and substeps, to set explicitly use -DjmxPort=9999
  • Type: java.lang.Integer
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${jmxPort}
  • Default: 9999

runTestsInForkedVM:

if true a jvm will be spawned to run substeps otherwise substeps will execute within the same jvm as maven
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: true

stepImplementationArtifacts:

List of classes containing step implementations e.g. com.technophobia.substeps.StepImplmentations
  • Type: java.util.List
  • Required: No

vmArgs:

A space delimited string of vm arguments to pass to the forked jvm
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
